# factoextraplus

[![R-CMD-check](https://img.shields.io/badge/R--CMD--check-passing-brightgreen)](https://github.com/erdeyl/factoextraplus)
[![License: GPL
v2](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-GPL%20v2-blue.svg)](https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0)
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.18131494.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18131494)

**A modernized fork of factoextra with full compatibility for ggplot2
4.0.0+, FactoMineR 2.13+, and R 4.1.0+**

## About This Package

This package is a **fork of factoextra** renamed to `factoextraplus` to
avoid package name conflicts while the upstream pull request
([kassambara/factoextra#194](https://github.com/kassambara/factoextra/pull/194))
is pending review.

Once the PR is merged and the original `factoextra` is updated on CRAN,
users can switch back to the original package.

**Note:** This package depends on `ggpubrplus` (the modernized fork of
`ggpubr`, version \>= 0.9.0) and `FactoMineR` (\>= 2.13).
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.18131490.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18131490)

## Breaking changes (since factoextra 1.0.7)

- Requires R \>= 4.1.0, ggplot2 \>= 4.0.0, FactoMineR \>= 2.13, and
  ggpubrplus \>= 0.9.0.
- Dependency switched from ggpubr to ggpubrplus (\>= 0.9.0).
- Hopkins statistic uses the corrected formula (Wright 2022); results
  differ from legacy factoextra and a one-time warning is emitted.
- Legacy FactoMineR category labels may no longer match; use
  [`map_factominer_legacy_names()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/map_factominer_legacy_names.md)
  to translate them.

### Migration examples

``` r
# Install from GitHub (install ggpubrplus first)
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("erdeyl/ggpubrplus@v0.9.0")
remotes::install_github("erdeyl/factoextraplus")

# Hopkins statistic (corrected formula; warns once per session)
get_clust_tendency(iris[, -5], n = 50)
# Silence the one-time warning if needed
options(factoextraplus.warn_hopkins = FALSE)

# Map legacy category labels from FactoMineR outputs
map_factominer_legacy_names(res.mfa, c("var.level"))
```

## Installation

``` r
# Install from GitHub (install ggpubrplus first)
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("erdeyl/ggpubrplus@v0.9.0")
remotes::install_github("erdeyl/factoextraplus")
```

## Key Fixes

### ggplot2 3.4.0+ Compatibility

- Replaced all `aes_string()` calls with `aes()` + `.data` pronoun
- Changed `guides(... = FALSE)` to `guides(... = "none")`
- Converted `size` to `linewidth` for line-based geoms

### FactoMineR 2.13 Compatibility

- MFA mixed-group support for quantitative/qualitative grouping and
  supplementary qualitative categories
- FactoMineR category mapping helpers for legacy label selections
- Robust partial coordinate name parsing when category labels contain
  dots

### R 4.1.0+ Fixes

- Fixed “condition has length \> 1” errors with proper
  [`inherits()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/class.html) checks

### Bug Fixes

- [`fviz_dend()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_dend.md)
  rect_border error
- [`fviz_nbclust()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_nbclust.md)
  cluster ordering for k \> 9
- [`fviz_nbclust()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_nbclust.md)
  silhouette calculation issues
- Hopkins statistic formula corrections (Wright 2022)
- [`facto_summarize()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/facto_summarize.md)
  axes parameter handling

## Citation

Please cite both the original package and this fork:

**Original package:** \> Kassambara A, Mundt F (2020). factoextra:
Extract and Visualize the Results of Multivariate Data Analyses. R
package version 1.0.7. <https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=factoextra>

**This fork:** \> Erdey L (2026). Supplementary compatibility updates
for factoextra (Kassambara & Mundt, 2020): Modern R ecosystem support
(ggplot2 ≥4.0.0, FactoMineR ≥2.13, R ≥4.1.0) — to be cited with the
original package. R package version 1.2.0.
<https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18131494>

## Original Package

This is based on the
[factoextra](https://github.com/kassambara/factoextra) package by
Dr. Alboukadel Kassambara.

For documentation of the original package, see:
<https://rpkgs.datanovia.com/factoextra/>

## License

GPL-2

## Credits

- **Original Authors**: Dr. Alboukadel Kassambara, Fabian Mundt
- **Maintainer**: Laszlo Erdey (Faculty of Economics and Business,
  University of Debrecen, Hungary)

# Package index

## Visualizing Dimension Reduction Analysis Outputs

Visualization of PCA, CA, MCA, FAMD, MFA and HMFA.

- [`get_eig()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/eigenvalue.md)
  [`get_eigenvalue()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/eigenvalue.md)
  [`fviz_eig()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/eigenvalue.md)
  [`fviz_screeplot()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/eigenvalue.md)
  : Extract and visualize the eigenvalues/variances of dimensions
- [`fviz_pca()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_pca.md)
  [`fviz_pca_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_pca.md)
  [`fviz_pca_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_pca.md)
  [`fviz_pca_biplot()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_pca.md)
  : Visualize Principal Component Analysis
- [`fviz_ca_row()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_ca.md)
  [`fviz_ca_col()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_ca.md)
  [`fviz_ca_biplot()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_ca.md)
  [`fviz_ca()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_ca.md)
  : Visualize Correspondence Analysis
- [`fviz_mca_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mca.md)
  [`fviz_mca_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mca.md)
  [`fviz_mca_biplot()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mca.md)
  [`fviz_mca()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mca.md)
  : Visualize Multiple Correspondence Analysis
- [`fviz_famd_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_famd.md)
  [`fviz_famd_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_famd.md)
  [`fviz_famd()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_famd.md)
  : Visualize Factor Analysis of Mixed Data
- [`fviz_mfa_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mfa.md)
  [`fviz_mfa_quali_biplot()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mfa.md)
  [`fviz_mfa_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mfa.md)
  [`fviz_mfa_axes()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mfa.md)
  [`fviz_mfa()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mfa.md)
  : Visualize Multiple Factor Analysis
- [`fviz_hmfa_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_hmfa.md)
  [`fviz_hmfa_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_hmfa.md)
  [`fviz_hmfa_quali_biplot()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_hmfa.md)
  [`fviz_hmfa()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_hmfa.md)
  : Visualize Hierarchical Multiple Factor Analysis
- [`fviz_cos2()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_cos2.md)
  : Visualize the quality of representation of rows/columns
- [`fviz_contrib()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_contrib.md)
  [`fviz_pca_contrib()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_contrib.md)
  : Visualize the contributions of row/column elements

## Extracting Data from Dimension Reduction Analysis Outputs

Extracting data from the output of PCA, CA, MCA, FAMD, MFA and HMFA.

- [`facto_summarize()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/facto_summarize.md)
  : Subset and summarize the output of factor analyses
- [`get_pca()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_pca.md)
  [`get_pca_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_pca.md)
  [`get_pca_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_pca.md)
  : Extract the results for individuals/variables - PCA
- [`get_ca()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_ca.md)
  [`get_ca_col()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_ca.md)
  [`get_ca_row()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_ca.md)
  : Extract the results for rows/columns - CA
- [`get_mca()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_mca.md)
  [`get_mca_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_mca.md)
  [`get_mca_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_mca.md)
  : Extract the results for individuals/variables - MCA
- [`get_famd()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_famd.md)
  [`get_famd_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_famd.md)
  [`get_famd_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_famd.md)
  : Extract the results for individuals and variables - FAMD
- [`get_mfa()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_mfa.md)
  [`get_mfa_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_mfa.md)
  [`get_mfa_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_mfa.md)
  [`get_mfa_partial_axes()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_mfa.md)
  : Extract the results for individuals/variables/group/partial axes -
  MFA
- [`get_hmfa()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_hmfa.md)
  [`get_hmfa_ind()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_hmfa.md)
  [`get_hmfa_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_hmfa.md)
  [`get_hmfa_partial()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_hmfa.md)
  : Extract the results for individuals/variables/group/partial axes -
  HMFA

## Clustering

Computing and visualizing clustering

- [`get_dist()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/dist.md)
  [`fviz_dist()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/dist.md)
  : Enhanced Distance Matrix Computation and Visualization
- [`get_clust_tendency()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/get_clust_tendency.md)
  : Assessing Clustering Tendency
- [`fviz_nbclust()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_nbclust.md)
  [`fviz_gap_stat()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_nbclust.md)
  : Dertermining and Visualizing the Optimal Number of Clusters
- [`fviz_dend()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_dend.md)
  : Enhanced Visualization of Dendrogram
- [`fviz_cluster()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_cluster.md)
  : Visualize Clustering Results
- [`fviz_silhouette()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_silhouette.md)
  : Visualize Silhouette Information from Clustering
- [`hcut()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/hcut.md)
  : Computes Hierarchical Clustering and Cut the Tree
- [`hkmeans()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/hkmeans.md)
  [`print(`*`<hkmeans>`*`)`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/hkmeans.md)
  [`hkmeans_tree()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/hkmeans.md)
  : Hierarchical k-means clustering
- [`eclust()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/eclust.md)
  : Visual enhancement of clustering analysis
- [`fviz_mclust()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mclust.md)
  [`fviz_mclust_bic()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_mclust.md)
  : Plot Model-Based Clustering Results using ggplot2

## Data

Data sets included in factoextra and used in examples.

- [`decathlon2`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/decathlon2.md)
  : Athletes' performance in decathlon
- [`housetasks`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/housetasks.md)
  : House tasks contingency table
- [`poison`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/poison.md)
  : Poison
- [`multishapes`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/multishapes.md)
  : A dataset containing clusters of multiple shapes

## Others

- [`clean_lock_files()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/clean_lock_files.md)
  : Clean up stale package lock files
- [`get_mfa_quanti_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`get_mfa_quali_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`get_mfa_group()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`fviz_mfa_ind_starplot()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`fviz_mfa_group()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`fviz_mfa_quanti_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`fviz_mfa_quali_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`get_hmfa_quanti_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`get_hmfa_quali_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`get_hmfa_group()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`fviz_hmfa_quanti_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`fviz_hmfa_quali_var()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`fviz_hmfa_ind_starplot()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  [`fviz_hmfa_group()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/deprecated.md)
  : Deprecated Functions
- [`factominer_category_map()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/factominer_category_map.md)
  : Map FactoMineR category labels to legacy naming patterns
- [`fviz_add()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_add.md)
  : Add supplementary data to a plot
- [`fviz()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz.md)
  : Visualizing Multivariate Analyse Outputs
- [`fviz_ellipses()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/fviz_ellipses.md)
  : Draw confidence ellipses around the categories
- [`map_factominer_legacy_names()`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/map_factominer_legacy_names.md)
  : Map legacy FactoMineR category names to current labels
- [`print(`*`<factoextra>`*`)`](https://erdeyl.github.io/factoextraplus/reference/print.factoextra.md)
  : Print method for an object of class factoextra
